snippet: The executions of at least nine Pashtuns in Afghanistan have been linked to the killings of two Hazaras, raising fears of continued revenge killings.
abstract: At least nine ethnic Pashtuns and perhaps many more are forced out of their homes in rural Afghanistan and executed by members of the Hazara, or Shiite branch of Islam, in what Afghan officials say is an act of revenge by one ethnic group against another; killings underscore the long shadow cast by country’s ethnic hatreds.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and SANGAR RAHIMI
byline.contributor: Habib Zahori and an employee of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The executions of at least nine Pashtuns in Afghanistan have been linked to the killings of two Hazaras, raising fears of continued revenge killings.

headline.seo: 9 Afghans Killed in Latest Ethnic Violence
headline.main: Afghan Officials Cite Revenge Killings in Latest Outbreak of Ethnic Hatred
headline.print_headline: Afghan Officials Cite Revenge Killings in Latest Outbreak of Ethnic Hatred
